column4: yeah, slackware is hard, and kinda stupid, but i know ubuntu can be better, but so far, it isnt
yeah, and its this whole sudo crap, im not used to it and ive been using linux for 3 years now
you know you can always just right-click on an iso to burn it to disk in nautilus, right?
not really, ive been using kde all this time
well, you can.
the other way to do it:  insert a cd.  a window will open.  put files in it.  File->write
the sudo thing is the Right Thing to do.  especially once it's explained to people
what is sudo exactly?
and if its so good, why dont other popular distros tech it?
coming from mac os x, it's very mac like
yeah,  i want that, kinda, but ive never used mac os x hardcore
i was using it for 2 years.  but i wanted a laptop and all.
it's been mentioned how you can enable a root user.  kwitcherbitchin :-)
what laptop do you have?
don't diss the speak and spell.  that thing taught me to read :-)
linux-kernel-2.6.8.1
yeah, but thats not in the synaptics package manager
what do you mean updated?
how do i update the package list?
in synaptics, hit Reload
did that, the newest kernel i see is 2.6.7
when i use the search feature for "kernel source"
i gave you the exact package name
got it, thanks
